metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8395 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: The Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.28, is vulnerable to an invalid write of size 8 because of missing a malloc() return-value check to see if memory had actually been allocated in the _bfd_generic_get_section_contents function. This vulnerability causes programs that conduct an analysis of binary programs using the libbfd library, such as objcopy, to crash.

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Manh-Dung Nguyen, Marcel BÃ¶hme, and Van-Thuan Pham

criterions.comment: binutils package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.32-8ubuntu1').
